ACTIVITY.SUBTITLE: Switches and Collision Domains

STEP.DESCRIPTION:
Switches provide many benefits to a network.
They reduce collisions by reducing the size of a collision domain.
Initially, switches monitor traffic and create a table of MAC addresses of all devices connected to it.
When a switch receives a frame, it checks the destination MAC address.
The switch now does a lookup of the MAC table, and if a match is found, only those frames are forwarded to the appropriate interface.
The switch prevents the frame from being forwarded through all ports, and reduces network traffic.
